title: Relative velocity - ball rolled on a train

content.question: A train travels in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction with speed <math alttext="v sub t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>t</mi></msub></math> relative to the ground. A passenger on the train rolls a ball across a level table in the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction at a constant speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> relative to the train. Another passenger quickly stops the ball and rolls it back with the same speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> relative to the train. Which of the following graphs could represent the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the velocity of the ball relative to the ground as a function of time?
